page.title: 06Old Peoples Home, Sandridge
page.content: The Salvation Army is a national organisation founded by William Booth in 1871,with groups in over 83 countries.During the 2nd World War the main headquarters in London was bombed,so General Lyndon Carpenter moved them to Sandridge village where they stayed for a number of years.Now Lyndon House is an old peoples home and has accommodation for 27 people,ladies over 60 and men over 65,the oldest resident is 97 and the youngest 73.The residents come from outside the Sandridge area.The people must be sponsored by their county.They are allowed a maximum of Â£300 in the bank and if possible they contribute towards their living expenses.The home is set in pleasant surroundings with a large garden.
